title: PHPlog()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPlog()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the natural logarithm of different numbers: "); echo(log(2) . "
"); echo(log(1) . "
"); echo(log(0)); ?> Definition and Usage The log() function returns the natural logarithm of a number, or the logarithm of number to base . Syntax log( number,base ); Parameter Values Parameter Description number Required. Specifies the value to calculate the logarithm for base Optional. The logarithmic base to use. Default is 'e' Technical Details Return Value: The natural logarithm of a number, or the logarithm of number to base Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4+ PHP Changelog: PHP 4.3: The base parameter were added ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPlog()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPlog()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPlog()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
